newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil portworkers may hold national strike - union.
newsitem.headline: Brazil portworkers may hold national strike - union.

text.p: Brazilian portworkers are scheduled to meet on Tuesday to decide whether to hold a national strike over wages on July 14, a union official said.
"A strike has been scheduled for July 14," said Jose Peres Cesar, president of the National Portworkers' Federation. "But I can only tell you after tomorrow if it will go ahead."
Portworker union delegates from most Brazilian ports will meet at 0900 local/1200 GMT Tuesday in Santos to discuss the possible strike.
Unions want a new collective wage agreement retroactive to June, Cesar said. The last round of collective agreements expired on June 30.
The potential duration of the strike had yet to be decided, he added. "That's something we will have to discuss tomorrow," he said.
